reviews.text: This place has always been a highlight of my trips to MT. The staff are always friendly and the dinosaur exhibit is state of the art, much better than the Smithsonian or the Museum of Natural History in Chicago. I cannot believe how many fossils they have on display. The full Tyrannosaurus skeleton was breathtaking. All of the panels describing the artifacts and dioramas are informative and interesting. Even with a lot of kids running around the Museum was a treat.

One of my favorite pass times is going to the museum. They have some rather breath-taking exhibits. The facility is well marked and clean. Not to mention the planetarium has some great showings! Would recommend for anyone in the area, whether you're a resident or just visiting.
Awesome place! Great for people of all ages and very affordable. Definitely worth it.

Great place to experience Montana's dinosaur past! A must-see while in Bozeman. Great, hands-on activities for kids. Come see the whole outdoor western exhibit in the summer to truly experience the old West!

The museum was so fun! If you need a little break, check out the planetarium movie or the Mindbender Mansion beyond the illustration exhibit. It is full of little puzzles you can do to join the little elite puzzle solving club (can't remember the name). It's mostly aimed towards children but three grown adults (my dad, my brother and myself) had a BLAST trying to solve the puzzles, as well as sometimes feeling a little dumb since we had trouble solving a couple of them. The dinosaur exhibit is beautiful and well put together. I certainly learned more in this museum than I have in a while!
Was in town for work researching a building. The staff was extremely helpful and nice. They have a great local archive and knowledgeable staff.
Very interesting! Can see that a lot of work and research was performed.

Definitely worth a stop and the $7 admission! The staff take you around for a brief guided tour to give and then let you explore more on your own. I really liked that because it’s nice to have some inside info but you don’t necessarily want to be on a two hour tour. It was about 40 minutes or so, depending on how many questions. Then spent another ~hour checking the rest of the place out. They had some old world war 1 items which were really neat.

The place is cool but issue was with the cashier/clerk. The sign says military and student admission is 5$ and I was charged at the higher cost and after showing both my military and student ID it was never changed to the correct amount. I was with a date and didn’t want to make an issue of it but I took out both ID’s and was told the student actually gets you a better discount yet it was never applied. Everything else was pleasant

What a wonderful Museum to bring family and learn about historic events. The other day they were specializing in the hundredth anniversary of the signing of the Armistice for World War. And they had an amazing hands on event for the whole family for children especially

What a great team to work with and a place to get married. We were married there in October and love everything about the day. The staff are nothing but accommodating and great to work with. We reserved the theatre for our rehearsal dinner and movie which everyone loved. We had our wedding ceremony and reception in the ballroom and loved every bit of it. Thanks again to the entire staff for being so easy to work with and being such a great price!!
A hub for awesomeness. The Emerson is a great place to eat as well as to take a peak at local art, host events, or catch a show. They even host the Bozeman Ice Fest here. It's a gem. Go see it.
Awesome dinner. Got pork chop. Also had eggplant Parmesan. Yummy. Great service too
One of my favorite places in Bozeman. Many wonderful events held here year round, talented artists work on display, and a beautiful old building.
Fun old building full of various forms of art. The local artists are pretty great, and they are creative. A must visit
The most amazing art gallery ive ever been inside... Most of the work was done by a local guy named Dennis and it is incredible. If you have time to swing by you will be glad you did!
Owner is friendly and does beautiful clay figures art
Good sandwiches, large portions, free pickles. I heard about this place from MSU alumni before I even came out to MT in 2012 so that tells you about its reputation. Worth your money.
Monster subs for a small price. Pickle barrel has some of the best sandwiches in town for a cheap price. Not only are they tasty, they're huge. You really get your money's worth.

I love the Pickle Barrel. The sandwiche selection is great whether you want a hot or a cold sandwich. The service is friendly and the food is always delicious. The portion sizes are not what you would expect but you can always guarantee you'll never leave hungry!
Not thrilled with the meatball marinara... the sauce tasted overwhelmingly like zucchini and the lettuce was a little on the funky side and not just from the sauce

Sandwiches were ok... hardly close to the best steak and cheese I’ve ever had. More like a glorified sloppy joe. Staff was rude and  unaccommodating when asked to make modifications so we could enjoy OUR food the way WE like it. Weird and unexpected experience... won’t be going back.
The standards for mall food are not that high, this place serves bad mall food. Of all the places in Bozeman for Asian style, this one is dead last. Spend your money elsewhere.

Famous Wok never disappoints. Their food is surprisingly fresh and flavorful. The staff is almost always able to answer questions about dietary concerns, and happy to accommodate if they are able. They have gluten free options too! Service is extraordinarily quick and surprisingly reasonable, considering the portion sizes. I often come here and split a 2 entree, rice/noodle combo with my 2 young boys, and we never finish the place. I have other friends who stop in to pick up full take-out containers to bring home to family - $45 will feed a family of 5, even if 2 of them are teenagers. #letsguide #takeout #onlyinbozeman #glutenfree
Always good actually fills me up!!

I ordered the Mongolian Beef for $12 and recieved a 
Styrofoam box filled with 95% onion and 5% beef. I will never eat at this place again.

Get the most entrees and the chow mein. Orange chicken and General Tso chicken are the best I've had around town at any buffet. They can always upgrade their food as I wouldn't mind trying something new as I trust them to do it.
Was awesome.  Told the guy was in a hurry, So he suggested the pulled pork. It was great , no  Complaints here!

Good lord.  This is amazing BBQ. I recommend the pulled pork, smoked turkey, and burnt ends. Their ribs are delicious as well.  Great homemade sides, homemade BBQ sauce, and some of the best customer service.  If you want BBQ in Bozeman or Belgrade; this is the place!  10/10

Some of the best BBQ I've had in some time.  Portions are large.  Prices are just right.  Staff was amazing, very friendly and helpful.   Highly recommend if you love good BBQ.   Really hope I can make it back here.

Food was great. I got the Spirit of San Antonio
For 46 bucks you get alot of good food.
Awesome meats, awesome sides. Be sure to try the hoppin' john and burnt ends

Great food and fun atmosphere. They went all out with the cat theme for the restaurant... Even the servers name tags! My one complaint is they only offer one vegan breakfast item. The mimosa menu is awesome!
The food was unreal, and I loved the unique look of the place. Great mimosas as well👌
Love this place for breakfast or brunch. Great food and great portions. The service was quick, friendly, and on point. Great for families or friends

Fantastic all-around. Excellent food from a great menu - nice mix of cafe/diner staples and some interesting surprises. The “Tom Cat” was one of the best burgers I’ve had in memory. Good coffee as well. Very friendly service and comfortable, cozy surrounds. 

Not crowded at all at 1pm on a Tuesday.

We waited for fifteen minutes after writing our name on their self serve "hostess" paper taped to the wall. No employee said hello or acknowledged our presence. So after standing in a stairwell (there's nowhere to sit) for 15 minutes and no one to give us a hint of how long we'd wait, we left.
Nice homely atmosphere.

I had an amazing dinner at The Bistro.  The food was amazing and I loved the atmosphere there!  The servers were very friendly and our food came out quickly and delicious!  I also love the wine selection.  Great dining experience!!  Can't wait to go again.

Please note that most of the bad reviews are from +3 years ago. This is my new favorite place to eat. Never have a long wait, the food is delicious, staff is good. All the burgers are delicious! Salads are real leafy greens (not crappy iceberg lettuce). The prices are cheaper than most in town. Portions are generous. I lived here 2 years without knowing about this place. You will not be disappointed!

John Bozeman's Bistro has been a reliable source of great food for many years. They train their employees well and do a good job of making you feel welcome. If you have special dietary needs there will always be something available for you. The last time I went was with a large group and our server was funny and didn't miss a beat handling the large table. 
The fries are good and the burgers for lunch are enormous.

I went to the Bistro for my birthday and had a great time!  The staff was so friendly and treated our whole table as if we were royalty.  i liked that the kids menu offered some grown up tastes so that my daughter could order off of it (she is not the macaroni and cheese type of girl!).  The food was beyond excellent and they had a great wine selection.  Can't wait to go again sometime soon!

So after recently being diagnosed as a celiac I've had a hard time going out to eat. Today I called up and spoke to a gentleman named  Carl and asked if they cater to the gluten free crowd such as myself. To my surprise after being on hold for all of 10 seconds he told my I'd have no issues with most of their menu. I just ate what has to be the best fish tacos of my life. And am now waiting to go back in a week to spend my 10 anniversary with this business. High marks from this guy!!!
